resources:
Photo quiz // Intro Welcome! This is a small quiz based on photos. Photos:\nDmitry Yarmiychuk // Navigation Start Next Again Submit Wiki // Content Descriptions The Pena Palace Question image Answer image // Questions and answers App error. The question can not be displayed. You\'re right! You are partly right. Your answer is incorrect. // Sea anemone / Actinia This photo is taken in the shallow waters of the beach in Laguna Beach (California, USA). What is the name of this multicellular animal?
Sea Devil
Actinia
Coastal aster
Sea anemone
Actinia
Sea anemone
It\'s a Actinia or a Sea anemone. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_anemone // Cabo da Roca The photo shows the westernmost point of the Eurasian continent. What\'s the name of this place?
Earth\'s End
Rock of Lisbon
Cape Roca
Large ledge
Cape Roca The most western point of Eurasia is Cape Roca. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cabo_da_Roca // Cabo da Roca Names How was the westernmost point of the Eurasian continent called before?
Rock of Lisbon
Large ledge
This place was known to the Romans as Promontorium Magnum (Large ledge) and during the Age of Sail as the Rock of Lisbon. // Victoria harbour What is the name of this natural landform harbour situated between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon in Hong Kong? Victoria This harbor is called Victoria. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Victoria_Harbour // Hong Kong Hong Kong gained full independence only in 1997. Which countries ruled this territory before?
Great Britain
Japan
Spain
India
Great Britain
Japan
Hong Kong was a British colony from 1842 to 1997, and from 1941 to 1945 was under Japanese occupation. // Sky tree This is the highest TV tower in the world, located in Tokyo. What is it called?
Earth\'s Arrow
Sky Tree
Space Lift
Miyabi
Sky Tree This tower is called \"Tokyo Sky Tree\". https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tokyo_Skytree // General Sherman This tree located in Sequoia National Park, USA. By volume, it is the largest known living single stem tree on Earth. What is it called?
General Sherman
Crannell Creek
Hyperion
Wawona Tree
General Sherman The name of this giant sequoia is General Sherman. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/General_Sherman_(tree) // Sagrada Familia In this photo is the interior of Basilica and Expiatory Church of the Holy Family designed by Antoni Gaudí. In which city is this church located? Barcelona Basilica and Expiatory Church of the Holy Family is located in Barcelona (Spain). https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sagrada_Família // Pena Palace It is the Pena Palace, the summer residence of the Portuguese royal family in Sintra. What architectural styles were used in the construction of this palace?
Classicism
Modernism
Neo-Gothic
Neo-Manueline
Neo-Gothic
Neo-Manueline
The architecture of the Pena palace is too eclectic and includes the following styles: Neo-Gothic, Neo-Manueline, Neo-Renaissance and Neo-Moorish. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pena_Palace // Pena Palace Before What was on the site of the Pena Palace, the former summer residence of the Portuguese royal family in Sintra?
Monastery
Watch tower
Lighthouse
(Nothing)
Monastery The palace is located on the site of a small monastery, destroyed by the earthquake of 1755. // Temple of Heaven This is the largest building in the temple complex, called the \"Temple of Heaven\" in Beijing. What did they pray for in this temple?
For good harvests
For the Emperor
For victories
For health
For good harvests The temple was built for ceremonies, mostly comprising prayers for good harvests. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Temple_of_Heaven // Temple of Heven - Religion This is the Temple of Heaven in Beijing. What religion did this temple belong to?
Taoism
Qaraism
Maturidi
Shinto
Taoism It has been considered as a Taoism temple. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taoism // Tokyo / Kyoto This is the bridge and one of the buildings of the Imperial Palace of Tokyo, the capital of Japan. What is the current name of the city - the former capital of Japan (until 1868)? Kyoto From 794 to 1868, the capital was in Heian-ky\ō, modern-day Kyoto. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capital_of_Japan // Other Error Unable to open link! Rotate the device to see the full image. Rotate the device to see another photo. Answer… Dmitriy Yarmiychuk The answer is required! Too many answers selected! +1 point +2 points // Exit dialog Exit app? If you exit the application, your progress will be reset. Cancel Pause Exit // Quiz result Total score: Congratulations! Not bad… Incredible! You answered correctly all the questions!
